description: This tender is a call for two-phase bid submissions, with Stage one focused on the qualification of interested suppliers and Stage Two inviting the pre-qualified bidders to submit financial presents for the procurement contract. The procurement contract is for the rebuilding of the bridge at Jake's Landing of Kejimkujik National Park, and as part of this task, potential bidders should realize the current conditions at this area of land for this transportation logistical task are required to be redesigned to erase any kind of impacts on both of public pedestrians' attractions locals' businesses.

full_summary:
====================================

**Stage 1 - Jake's Landing Pedestrian Bridge Kejimkujik National Park and National Historic Site**

**Solicitation Number:** 5P468-23-0150/A
**Tender Closing Date:** August 22, 2023, 2:00 PM
**Expected Contract Start and End Dates:** March 4, 2024 - March 31, 2024

**Notice of Tender:**

Parks Canada invites qualified contractors to participate in a two-stage selection process for the construction of a pedestrian bridge at Jake's Landing, Kejimkujik National Park and National Historic Site. The project involves the assessment of the current crossing location, design and construction of the abutments and bridge superstructure.

**Project Description:**

The Jake's Landing area offers various visitor experience opportunities, including boat access to the Mersey River and Kejimikujik Lake, hiking trails, and boat rentals. The existing floating trail bridge is in poor condition and was damaged during Hurricane Fiona. The project will require the assessment of the current crossing location, including elevation and location surveys, geotechnical investigations, and hydraulic analysis.

**Pre-Qualification Requirements:**

All bidders must meet the requirements outlined in the solicitation document. The Bidder should have expertise in offsite construction services, bridge construction and repair services, and land pre-construction assessment services.

**Submission Requirements:**

Bidders must submit their bids by email to soumissionsami-bidsrpc@pc.gc.ca or by fax to 1-855-983-1808. Emails with attachments larger than 15 megabytes will not be accepted. The maximum file size is 15 megabytes, and bidders are responsible for any transmission or receipt issues due to file size.

**Optional Site Visit:**

The Bidder or a representative is recommended to visit the work site at Jake's Landing Canoe Rental Booth on August 8, 2023, at 11:00 AM Local time. The visit is mandatory for bidders who wish to participate in the technical and contractual questions.

**Quotation and Award:**

The successful Bidder will be determined based on their capability to meet the technical requirements and their ability to price the project correctly. The contract will be awarded based on the overall evaluation of the Bidder's submissions.

**Timeline:**

- **August 22, 2023:** Tender closing date
- **August 23, 2023:** Bids will be evaluated
